document_data.name: Hori Gutsu
document_data.mainbody: '''Hori Gutsu''' was a [[samurai]] retainer of the [[Niwa clan]], who ran a posthouse in [[Kozakura]] in [[1357 DR]].
document_data.Activities: In a very tranquil posthouse inside a Niwa [[shoen]], located at an equal distance between [[Tamanokuni]] and [[Kuda]], he led a company of ten samurai and thirty [[bushi]], plus twenty servants, mostly from the [[Hori clan]].
document_data.Personality: Hori was very proud of his position and took any kind of flaw in the performance of the posthouse as a personal offense. If someone lied about a flaw, then Hori would seek revenge against the slanderer.
